name: v3.6.0
body: Various updates, including version and build fixes.

name: Bitcoin Explorer 3.2.0
body:
These binaries require no installation, simply download and run the single file. Mainnet, testnet and altcoins are supported based on configuration and parameterization. You can verify the downloads using the signed SHA256 hashes below.

This release requires [libbitcoin-server](https://github.com/libbitcoin/libbitcoin-server) v3.0/v3.1 or later for some online operations. This a minor release that changes the output format of the `tx-decode` command.

```
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA256

# Bitcoin Explorer v3.2.0

$ bx base16-encode < bx-linux-x64-qrcode | bx sha256
55f356f75c118df961e0442d0776f1d71e0b9e91936b1d9b96934f5eba167f0c

$ bx base16-encode < bx-osx-x64-qrcode | bx sha256
aa2311e4549cfddd47b9a7410889c075a2fa14812e9d9e6ddfe36631bf49f813

$ bx base16-encode < bx-windows-x64-icu.exe | bx sha256
862d3f5b5acf771fb2821d935abd00ab4bebcd86a1972ba4bd1a19dd5b8b3f7e

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
Version: GnuPG v2.0.22 (GNU/Linux)

iQEcBAEBCAAGBQJZCM1QAAoJEDzYwH8LXOFO3OEH/jQxjqwHbuvVHwYS46FukKnP
IQkWF0H9Pzb8I1sutbnja+fJpBf/75SNLWb6ro3H/2IfkxEKCO8anWrk4+KTsWk8
0gs55LdqWvUtFVo6woYT+5mE1wD5cpJdodUuyEeRIXE7YwHE/YAFFQmJ4rMRSLsY
p4g0P6Ddt7R9TMpTDLMrymuIY20/fjbKohdfAsRywoq2JD8qasMM4/318xfv4dfi
aCouiI71PN7tIoujKKu9MbVjxK1e1F2YaKiEdVuwnVJe3ifwGj3MmNwfpIat1/cO
dJAn6Vuc9A7Cy3L34JwYOBOFaOYoNsIZZ8WgtJv1IPOwuWwCyRxc6pajlejCmRI=
=/ii4
-----END PGP SIGNATURE-----
```

These binaries require no installation, simply download and run the single file. Mainnet, testnet and altcoins are now supported based on configuration and parameterization. You can verify the downloads using the signed SHA256 hashes below.

This release requires [libbitcoin-server](https://github.com/libbitcoin/libbitcoin-server) v3.0/v3.1 for some online operations.

name: Bitcoin Explorer 3.0.0
body:
These binaries require no installation, simply download and run the single file. Mainnet, testnet and altcoins are now supported based on configuration and parameterization. You can verify the downloads using the signed SHA256 hashes below.

This release requires [libbitcoin-server](https://github.com/libbitcoin/libbitcoin-server) v3 for some online operations. There is a new `fetch-utxo` command for selecting unspent outputs owned by an address. There is also a new `qrcode` command (not available in the Windows build), for generating qrcode data and images.

```
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA256

# Bitcoin Explorer v3.0.0

$ bx base16-encode < bx-linux-x64-qrcode | bx sha256
79c91d5714c1a2edf6c4610507e49d478c929d2e3fb5705fda1a1e31ce2c3f72

$ bx base16-encode < bx-osx-x64-qrcode | bx sha256
177c278c96d351cfc0655770a7e48674fc5ad77a7f4472af4542c1eb18e058ac

$ bx base16-encode < bx-windows-x64-icu.exe | bx sha256
ad46a887bee8a0d4343cb2ff44a843f2d71ab33f3f860082e7d7f5fc20bb6633

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
Version: GnuPG v2.0.22 (GNU/Linux)

=JXiz
-----END PGP SIGNATURE-----
```

name: Bitcoin Explorer 2.2.0
body:
This is a minor release, providing enhanced networking behavior for the `send-tx-p2p` and `send-tx-node` commands. You can verify the downloads using the signed SHA256 hashes below.

name: Bitcoin Explorer 2.1.0
body:
This release supports both [Obelisk](https://github.com/spesmilo/obelisk) and the new [libbitcoin-server](https://github.com/libbitcoin/libbitcoin-server). Support for Electrum mnemonics has been replaced with [BIP39](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0039.mediawiki) commands and libbitcoin-server certificate creation and derivation commands have been added. The command line and configuration settings now support Unicode in Windows builds.  You can verify the downloads using the [signed](https://pgp.mit.edu/pks/lookup?op=get&search=0x3CD8C07F0B5CE14E) SHA256 hashes below.

```

e7ad781c48c7d2404008e20190bf414e5396927f546a4d9ba0ca76541009ac9c
```

name: Bitcoin Explorer 2.0.0
body: This is the initial release of Bitcoin Explorer, the successor to the SX command line tool.
